headline.main: Medicaid Expansion Poses Test for Some Democrats

docs.abstract: The Democrats' desire to expand Medicaid can make them feel politically conflicted, because states that tend to vote Republican may get a disproportionate amount of the federal aid.
docs.snippet: The Democrats' desire to expand Medicaid can make them feel politically conflicted, because states that tend to vote Republican may get a disproportionate amount of the federal aid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Max Baucus, the Montana Democrat who is leading bipartisan negotiations on health care legislation, on Monday said he would include in his bill a proposal by the Obama White House to bar illegal immigrants from buying health coverage through a new insurance marketplace, or exchange, even if the illegal immigrants were willing and able to pay the full cost.

headline.main: Baucus Bill Would Bar Illegal Immigrants From Insurance Exchanges

docs.abstract: Senator Baucus said he would include in his bill a proposal by the Obama White House to bar illegal immigrants from buying health coverage through a new insurance marketplace, or exchange.
docs.snippet: Senator Baucus said he would include in his bill a proposal by the Obama White House to bar illegal immigrants from buying health coverage through a new insurance marketplace, or exchange.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Harwood of The New York Times and CNBC interviews President Obama about the United State economy, his health care plan and the war in Afghanistan.

headline.sub: With John Harwood of The Times and CNBC

docs.snippet: John Harwood of The New York Times and CNBC interviews President Obama about the United State economy, his health care plan and the war in Afghanistan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, Sept. 15, 2 p.m. | Jefferson Cowie and Nick Salvatore of Cornell University have been added to this forum.
docs.abstract: For conservatives, a potent political label and a threat to core principles.
docs.snippet: For conservatives, a potent political label and a threat to core principles.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the unintended consequences of near-universal coverage in Massachusetts, with profound lessons for Washington, has been a deepening shortage of primary care doctors for the newly insured.

headline.main: With So Many Now Insured, Finding a Doctor Gets Even Harder in Massachusetts

docs.abstract: The shortage of primary care doctors in Massachusetts continues to deepen, according to the latest survey since the state required near-universal coverage in 2006.
docs.snippet: The shortage of primary care doctors in Massachusetts continues to deepen, according to the latest survey since the state required near-universal coverage in 2006.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama's embattled health care plan will get a welcome and full-throated push from the A.F.L.-C.I.O. on Tuesday.

headline.main: A.F.L.-C.I.O. to Push for Overhaul With Public Option

docs.abstract: President Obama's plans for a health care overhaul will get a much-needed boost from one of the nation's most powerful lobbying forces.
docs.snippet: President Obama's plans for a health care overhaul will get a much-needed boost from one of the nation's most powerful lobbying forces.

docs.lead_paragraph: The fourth in our series on President Obama's speech today -- a year after the collapse of Lehman Brothers -- on financial regulation and the economy.

headline.main: Obama's Speech: Still Fighting the Last War

docs.abstract: In a series on President Obama's speech today on financial regulation, a look back at the financial reforms spurred by the 1990s Asian financial crisis.
docs.snippet: In a series on President Obama's speech today on financial regulation, a look back at the financial reforms spurred by the 1990s Asian financial crisis.

docs.lead_paragraph: Should older people pay more for health insurance than younger people, and if so, how much more?

headline.main: How Much Should Older Americans Pay for Insurance?

docs.abstract: Under Senator Baucus's health plan, insurers would be permitted to charge older adults up to five times more than young adults are charged, a dramatic increase from previous proposals.
docs.snippet: Under Senator Baucus's health plan, insurers would be permitted to charge older adults up to five times more than young adults are charged, a dramatic increase from previous proposals.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama travels to New York City today -- exactly one year after the collapse of Lehman Brothers rocked Wall Street and prompted one of the biggest government interventions in history -- to try to explain and rally support for the government's exit strategy.
docs.abstract: The president tackles government oversight of Wall Street.
docs.snippet: The president tackles government oversight of Wall Street.

docs.lead_paragraph: When President Obama travels to Wall Street today to speak from Federal Hall, where the founders once argued bitterly over how much the government should control the national economy, he is likely to cast himself as a "reluctant shareholder" in America's biggest industries and financial institutions.

headline.main: As Obama Goes to Wall St., Bailouts Still in Focus

docs.abstract: One year after the collapse of Lehman Brothers set off a series of federal interventions, the government is the nation's biggest lender, insurer, automaker and guarantor against risk for investors large and small.
docs.snippet: One year after the collapse of Lehman Brothers set off a series of federal interventions, the government is the nation's biggest lender, insurer, automaker and guarantor against risk for investors large and small.
